dp.name: DP — Fibonacci Bottom-Up
dp.description: Compute the nth Fibonacci number using bottom-up dynamic programming with a table or rolling variables. Return the value of F(n).

dp.name: DP — Climbing Stairs
dp.description: Given n stairs, compute how many distinct ways you can climb to the top by taking steps of size 1 or 2 using bottom-up DP.

dp.name: DP — House Robber
dp.description: Given a list of integers representing money in houses, compute the maximum amount you can rob without robbing adjacent houses using rolling DP.

dp.name: DP — Longest Increasing Subsequence (O(n^2))
dp.description: Compute the length of the longest strictly increasing subsequence using O(n²) dynamic programming.

dp.name: DP — Jump Game Reachability
dp.description: Given an array where nums[i] indicates max jump length at index i, determine whether it is possible to reach the last index using DP or greedy logic.

dp.name: DP — Coin Change (Minimum Coins)
dp.description: Given coin denominations and a target amount, compute the fewest coins needed to reach the target using bottom-up DP. Return -1 if impossible.
dp.signature: def coin_change(coins: List[int], amount: int) -> int:

dp.name: DP — Longest Common Subsequence
dp.description: Compute the length of the longest common subsequence between two strings using a 2D dynamic programming table.
dp.signature: def lcs(text1: str, text2: str) -> int:

dp.name: DP — Edit Distance
dp.description: Compute the minimum number of operations (insert, delete, replace) required to convert one string into another using 2D dynamic programming.
dp.signature: def edit_distance(s1: str, s2: str) -> int:

dp.name: DP — Grid Minimum Path Sum
dp.description: Given a grid of non-negative numbers, compute the minimum path sum from top-left to bottom-right using 2D DP, moving only right or down.

dp.name: DP — Longest Palindromic Subsequence
dp.description: Given a string, compute the length of the longest palindromic subsequence using interval DP with a 2D table.

dp.name: DP — Count Palindromic Substrings
dp.description: Count the number of palindromic substrings in a string using dynamic programming over substring intervals.
